thread.title: Dan Vickerman, former Wallabies player, dies aged 37 | Sport | The Guardian
thread.title_full: Dan Vickerman, former Wallabies player, dies aged 37 | Sport | The Guardian

author: Guardian Sport
title: Dan Vickerman, former Wallabies player, dies aged 37 | Sport | The Guardian
text:
Australia rugby union team Dan Vickerman, former Wallabies player, dies aged 37 
‘Uncompromising competitor’, who died at his family home on Saturday night, is survived by his wife and two children Dan Vickerman’s Wallabies career took in 63 Test matches and spanned nine years. Photograph: Cameron Spencer/Getty Images View more sharing options Sunday 19 February 2017 04.59 GMT Last modified on Sunday 19 February 2017 05.06 GMT 
The former rugby union player Dan Vickerman, a veteran of 63 Tests for Australia, has died at the age of 37. 
Vickerman died on Saturday night and is survived by his wife and two children. 
The Cape Town-born lock played 63 Tests for the Wallabies between 2002 and 2011, before his retirement from the game in 2012 with a persistent injury problem. 
He had been working in commercial real estate since. 
“The rugby world is in shock today after news of the tragic passing of Dan Vickerman,” the Australian Rugby Union chief executive, Bill Pulver, said on Sunday. 
“Dan was an uncompromising competitor who forged a wonderful international rugby career despite a number of injury setbacks along the way. 
“He was an enforcer on the field and a much-loved character off the field. He cared deeply about the game and the players, helping players transition into life after rugby in his role with RUPA following his retirement.“Our thoughts and prayers are with Dan’s family at this extremely difficult time.” 
More to follow.
